Practical Construction.definition: the interpretation of the terms of a contract as shown by the performance of the parties that may be used by the court to help determine the intent of the parties ;also

1.definition: the interpretation of the terms of a contract as shown by the performance of the parties that may be used by the court to help determine the intent of the partiesthe doctrine that permits such a method of discerning intent compare

2.definition: interpretation of a statute or document in a manner that does not defeat its purpose esp. when a strict interpretation would produce clearly unintended or absurd results
